description: From Late Latin plānārius (“relating to a plane”), derived from Latin plānus (“flat”, “level”), ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *pleh₂- (“flat”).

adjectives.description: planar (comparative more planar, superlative most planar)

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to a plane.
examples: A planar projection of a three-dimensional object is its projection onto a plane.

entries.meaning: (graph theory, of a graph) Able to be embedded in the plane with no edges intersecting.
examples: A complete graph with more than four nodes is never planar.

entries.meaning: (transistor chip, semiconductor devices) Having a flat profile, not etched into a mesa.
